name: recodification
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
the act or process of arranging something such as laws or rules again, into a new or different system: It's the first time such an overhaul of state legislation has been proposed since recodification of game laws in the 1980s. the recodification of the personal income tax laws
More examplesFewer examplesThey are calling for a re-codification of state water laws.He calls the housing bill a purely technical recodification of affordable housing statutes.Under a 1993 re-codification of workers' laws, a premises owner can be classified as a general contractor.
